intro: Corchorus hirtus var. argentinensis, commonly known as the Argentine burrweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, often covered in fine hairs, and it produces distinctive, spiny capsules that contain numerous seeds. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
